name: df-pc
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cpc, cmpo(s0, s1, cprime, cq, cif(cpnf, cio(s2, wrex(s3, cz, wrex(s4, cn, wa(wceq(cv(s1), co(cv(s3), cdiv, cv(s4))), wceq(cv(s2), co(csup(crab(s5, cn0, wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, cv(s5)), cdvds, cv(s3))), cr, clt), cmin, csup(crab(s5, cn0, wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, cv(s5)), cdvds, cv(s4))), cr, clt))))))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
comment: Define the prime count function, which returns the largest exponent of a given prime (or other positive integer) that divides the number. For rational numbers, it returns negative values according to the power of a prime in the denominator. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
